This is _not_ my day!!!   
I realize now that I posted an alternate...   
I apologize once again... ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526222048im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/uhoh.gif)   
   
Now, **This** is a standard letter from the same font   
 ![HINT02](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526222048im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/47515.gif)
Uppercase T , F ?

No... not F or T...   
Here is a little more:   
   
 ![hint03](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526222048im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/47530.gif)   
   
Please tell me if you want any hints.   
I don�t want to be the one who kills the quiz this time!

Hint:   
The designer of the font is also the founder   
of the foundry from which the font is released.   
   
Designer: Rodrigo Xavier Cavazos   
Foundry: Psy/Ops

Please go ahead Tiffany. I suck at posting challenges.   
   
:-)

Alright... Here�s the new challenge:   
 ![newhint01](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526222048im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/47537.gif)
ampersand?

Ampersand is correct... :-)   
   
Here it is, cropped differently...   
 ![newhint02](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526222048im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/47540.gif)

Either it is kinda dead in here tonight   
or somebody really hates me...   
   
I begin to feel like a complete monkey!   
   
This is why I hate being the one posting the challenge Tiffany!

Actually, I just _did_ post a hint! ;-)   
   
Edit: Maybe not a very sophisticated hint, but still...
House Orangutan?

Exactly!!!!   
   
 ![newhint](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526222048im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/47553.gif)   
   
Your turn!

OK, here you go. Tiff'll prolly get this right off the bat.   
   
 ![popquiz](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526222048im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/47565.gif)
Well, guess I was wrong, then... ;)
I didn't think it was a stupid question, but nevertheless, I don't think it has anything to do with him. Though he did dabble in different
Hm, the email posting doesn't seem to be working so hot. Anyway, that was "Though he did dabble in different styles..."

Here's another view of the same glyph for you...   
   
 ![popquiz](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526222048im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/47569.gif)
Why, yes it is. In more than one sense, even.

OK, here's a bit more:   
   
 ![popquiz](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526222048im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/47577.jpg)

[�Samba!](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526222048/http:/www.linotype.com/92026/samba-family.html)   
   
The uppercase (or non-alternate) 'A' from the Expert weight to be exact.

Zamba?   
   
:D
Sorry, Stuart. Beat ya by two.

I know, I was making light of Bruno's presentation to the DiMarco brothers at Typecon . . . .   
   
No Zzzzamba . . . .Es Ssssamba!   
   
:D

Righty-o, you TypeCon attendees. Es SssssssAMBAAAAAAA! And coming soon, Samba METALLLLLLLL!   
   
Yer turn, Grant.
Nah, it's just a bit of residual TypeCon-tamination clearing itself out of Chesh's system.
